location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Henry Moore, John Beaumont, George Green, George Skipp, and William Lewis, all at the East India Company Agency at Bussora [Basra], to James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter contains detailed instructions for the deployment of ships after the expedition against Carrack [Kharg] Island, including an order to provide protection for the Berkshire,which comes from Muscat. Various payments for rent and expenses are discussed and there is a further reminder that withdrawal from Bushire should be made should sufficient risk be felt.
